cards.flavor: "A slayer gets by on wits and reflexes." —Higa, slayer-captain of Gatstaf
cards.name: Aim High
cards.text: Untap target creature. It gets +2/+2 and gains reach until end of turn. (It can block creatures with flying.)

cards.flavor: The harmony of the glorious is a dirge to the wicked.
cards.name: Angelic Chorus
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you gain life equal to its toughness.

cards.name: Angelic Gift
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Angelic Gift enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has flying.

cards.flavor: Bitter vengeance never glowed so bright nor sang so sweet.
cards.name: Angel of Retribution
cards.text: Flying, first strike

cards.name: Apocalypse Hydra
cards.text:
Apocalypse Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it. If X is 5 or more, it enters the battlefield with an additional X +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}{R}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Apocalypse Hydra: Apocalypse Hydra deals 1 damage to any target.

cards.name: Arcane Artisan
cards.text:
{2}{U}, {T}: Target player draws a card, then exiles a card from their hand. If a creature card is exiled this way, that player creates a token that's a copy of that card.
When Arcane Artisan leaves the battlefield, exile all tokens created with it at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Archfiend of Despair
cards.text:
Flying
Your opponents can't gain life.
At the beginning of each end step, each opponent loses life equal to the life that player lost this turn. (Damage causes loss of life.)

cards.name: Archon of Valor's Reach
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance, trample
As Archon of Valor's Reach enters the battlefield, choose artifact, enchantment, instant, sorcery, or planeswalker.
Players can't cast spells of the chosen type.

cards.flavor: "I see something special in you—a bright ember that yearns to dance among the stars."
cards.name: Arena Rector
cards.text: When Arena Rector dies, you may exile it. If you do, search your library for a planeswalker card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: "This is how wars are won—not with armies of soldiers but with a single knife blade, artfully placed." —Yurin, royal assassin
cards.name: Assassinate
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.flavor: When Selesnya missionaries moved into the Shanav Quarter, they faced scorn, ridicule, and ultimately martyrdom.
cards.name: Assassin's Strike
cards.text: Destroy target creature. Its controller discards a card.

cards.flavor: "Finally, a weapon the Boros can't confiscate!" —Juri, proprietor of the Juri Revue
cards.name: Auger Spree
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/-4 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Many combatants at Valor's Reach wield glowing weapons to distract their enemies and delight the crowd.
cards.name: Aurora Champion
cards.text: Whenever Aurora Champion attacks, if your team controls another Warrior, tap target creature.

cards.flavor: "Never get too attached to a weapon. You must allow a better one to find its way to you."
cards.name: Azra Bladeseeker
cards.text: When Azra Bladeseeker enters the battlefield, each player on your team may discard a card, then each player who discarded a card this way draws a card.

cards.flavor: "I never give odds on my own fights. Unless, of course, you want to bet against me . . ."
cards.name: Azra Oddsmaker
cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, you may discard a card. If you do, choose a creature. Whenever that creature deals combat damage to a player this turn, you draw two cards.

cards.flavor: The scent of cooked flesh lingers in the charred landscape of Tarkir.
cards.name: Bathe in Dragonfire
cards.text: Bathe in Dragonfire deals 4 damage to target creature.

cards.flavor: "There is elegance in all the Ojutai do—even their killing." —Kirada, Silumgar enforcer
cards.name: Battle Mastery
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has double strike. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

cards.flavor: "I will build no sanctuaries. The safety you seek can be won only by the sword." —Yannash, outpost builder
cards.name: Battle Rampart
cards.text:
Defender
{T}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The shaman rattles not to inspire a battle fury but to drown out the shrieks of those fleeing the Eldrazi.
cards.name: Battle-Rattle Shaman
cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, you may have target creature get +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Monsters dwell in every heart. We only think civilization tames them." ―Euphemia, Nexus watcher
cards.name: Beast Within
cards.text: Destroy target permanent. Its controller creates a 3/3 green Beast creature token.

cards.flavor: "Some fates you can see coming for you, plain as day, and there's nothing you can do about them." —Callaphe the mariner
cards.name: Benthic Giant
cards.text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.name: Blaring Captain
cards.text:
Partner with Blaring Recruiter (When this creature enters the battlefield, target player may put Blaring Recruiter into their hand from their library, then shuffle.)
Whenever Blaring Captain attacks, attacking Warriors get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Blaring Recruiter
cards.text:
Partner with Blaring Captain (When this creature enters the battlefield, target player may put Blaring Captain into their hand from their library, then shuffle.)
{2}{W}: Create a 1/1 white Warrior creature token.

cards.flavor: Fire never dies alone.
cards.name: Blaze
cards.text: Blaze deals X damage to any target.

cards.flavor: The ring plays host to some combatants that the spectators love to hate.
cards.name: Bloodborn Scoundrels
cards.text:
Assist (Another player can pay up to {5} of this spell's cost.)
When Bloodborn Scoundrels enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

cards.flavor: Succession is a matter of blood, and by blood it is often decided.
cards.name: Blood Feud
cards.text: Target creature fights another target creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

cards.flavor: "Now everyone knows what you are."
cards.name: Boldwyr Intimidator
cards.text:
Cowards can't block Warriors.
{R}: Target creature becomes a Coward until end of turn.
{2}{R}: Target creature becomes a Warrior until end of turn.

cards.flavor: When the twin-spell bonus round begins, the crowd rises to its feet in anticipation of incredible combinations.
cards.name: Bonus Round
cards.text: Until end of turn, whenever a player casts an instant or sorcery spell, that player copies it and may choose new targets for the copy.

cards.flavor: Though she is rightly feared, there are relatively few tales of her deeds in battle, for few survive her raids.
cards.name: Borderland Marauder
cards.text: Whenever Borderland Marauder attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: No pilgrimage to Valor's Reach is complete without a stroll through its celebrated shopping district.
cards.name: Bountiful Promenade
cards.text:
Bountiful Promenade enters the battlefield tapped unless you have two or more opponents.
{T}: Add {G} or {W}.

cards.flavor: "Within this grove, you belong to me."
cards.name: Bramble Sovereign
cards.text: Whenever another nontoken creature enters the battlefield, you may pay {1}{G}. If you do, that creature's controller creates a token that's a copy of that creature.

cards.name: Brightling
cards.text:
{W}: Brightling gains vigilance until end of turn.
{W}: Brightling gains lifelink until end of turn.
{W}: Return Brightling to its owner's hand.
{1}: Brightling gets +1/-1 or -1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Big, wicked, and not too smart. Poor thing never stood a chance against us, dear." —Regna, to Krav
cards.name: Bring Down
cards.text:
Assist (Another player can pay up to {3} of this spell's cost.)
Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater.

cards.flavor: There will always be a spot at Valor's Reach for headlong violence.
cards.name: Bull-Rush Bruiser
cards.text: Whenever Bull-Rush Bruiser attacks, if your team controls another Warrior, Bull-Rush Bruiser gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.flavor: On Bant, a sigil is both a prize of honor and a bond of duty. The one who bears it may be called to fulfill that charge at any moment.
cards.name: Call to Heel
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand. Its controller draws a card.

cards.flavor: It keeps the upper reaches of the forest free of every menace . . . except for the spider itself.
cards.name: Canopy Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.flavor: Instructors at the Kasarna training grounds are capable healers in case their students fail to grasp the subtleties of combat.
cards.name: Centaur Healer
cards.text: When Centaur Healer enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Chain Lightning
cards.text: Chain Lightning deals 3 damage to any target. Then that player or that permanent's controller may pay {R}{R}. If the player does, they may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

cards.name: Chakram Retriever
cards.text:
Partner with Chakram Slinger (When this creature enters the battlefield, target player may put Chakram Slinger into their hand from their library, then shuffle.)
Whenever you cast a spell during your turn, untap target creature.

cards.name: Chakram Slinger
cards.text:
Partner with Chakram Retriever (When this creature enters the battlefield, target player may put Chakram Retriever into their hand from their library, then shuffle.)
{R}, {T}: Chakram Slinger deals 2 damage to target player or planeswalker.

cards.flavor: "The blood of Dromoka and the blood of my veins are the same."
cards.name: Champion of Arashin
cards.text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.flavor: Arena beasts are bred for flashiness and foul temper. An extra head addresses both requirements.
cards.name: Charging Binox
cards.text:
Assist (Another player can pay up to {7} of this spell's cost.)
Trample

cards.flavor: The knights of Troinir Keep took the rhino as their emblem due to its intense focus when charging down a perceived threat—a trait they discovered on a hunting excursion.
cards.name: Charging Rhino
cards.text: Charging Rhino can't be blocked by more than one creature.

cards.flavor: "Punch 'em, kick 'em, bite 'em, beat 'em! Burn 'em all and we'll defeat 'em!"
cards.name: Cheering Fanatic
cards.text: Whenever Cheering Fanatic attacks, choose a card name. Spells with the chosen name cost {1} less to cast this turn.

cards.flavor: Six feet of earth muffled his cries.
cards.name: Claustrophobia
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Claustrophobia enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

cards.flavor: Success at Valor's Reach requires not only individual skill but also the ability to merge that skill with a partner's.
cards.name: Combo Attack
cards.text: Two target creatures your team controls each deal damage equal to their power to target creature.

cards.flavor: All skyships entering or leaving the fairgrounds must pass through the security checkpoint.
cards.name: Consulate Skygate
cards.text:
Defender
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.flavor: "She knows every step of this coastline, both above and below the surface, and she has hideouts all along the way. She will get you there." —Jori En, expedition leader
cards.name: Coralhelm Guide
cards.text: {4}{U}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.

cards.flavor: Consulate guards who pursue fleeing renegades into the Cowl often become lost—occasionally permanently—in the city's wildest greenbelt.
cards.name: Cowl Prowler

cards.flavor: "Forswear the flesh and you will truly see." —Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur
cards.name: Culling Dais
cards.text:
{T}, Sacrifice a creature: Put a charge counter on Culling Dais.
{1}, Sacrifice Culling Dais: Draw a card for each charge counter on Culling Dais.

cards.flavor: "Petrifying gaze, deadly fangs, knifelike dorsal spines, venomous saliva . . . Am I missing anything? . . . Toxic bones? Seriously?" —Samila, Murasa Expeditionary House
cards.name: Daggerback Basilisk
cards.text: Deathtouch

cards.flavor: One of the many reasons why open-air markets close at dusk.
cards.name: Daggerdrome Imp
cards.text:
Flying
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.flavor: The oddsmakers hate him because every fight is a foregone conclusion. The crowd loves him for exactly the same reason.
cards.name: Decorated Champion
cards.text: Whenever another Warrior enters the battlefield under your team's control, put a +1/+1 counter on Decorated Champion.

cards.name: Diabolic Intent
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: "Welcome to the Dimir Public Offices. Not responsible for death or loss of property. Basement off-limits." —Sign outside Dinrova Building
cards.name: Dinrova Horror
cards.text: When Dinrova Horror enters the battlefield, return target permanent to its owner's hand, then that player discards a card.

cards.flavor: There is only one fate left to those banished from the God-Pharaoh's city.
cards.name: Doomed Dissenter
cards.text: When Doomed Dissenter dies, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

cards.flavor: He vowed he would never rest until he reached his destination. He doesn't know how right he was.
cards.name: Doomed Traveler
cards.text: When Doomed Traveler dies, create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.

cards.name: Doubling Season
cards.text:
If an effect would create one or more tokens under your control, it creates twice that many of those tokens instead.
If an effect would put one or more counters on a permanent you control, it puts twice that many of those counters on that permanent instead.

cards.name: Dragon Breath
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has haste.
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
When a creature with converted mana cost 6 or greater enters the battlefield, you may return Dragon Breath from your graveyard to the battlefield attached to that creature.

cards.flavor: "Those dragons grow fast. For a while they feed on squirrels and goblins and then suddenly you're missing a mammoth." —Hurdek, Mazar mammoth trainer
cards.name: Dragon Hatchling
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Dragon Hatchling gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Dwarven Lightsmith
cards.text:
Assist (Another player can pay up to {5} of this spell's cost.)
When Dwarven Lightsmith enters the battlefield, creatures your team controls get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Loyal to a fault, it anticipates its master's every need.
cards.name: Eager Construct
cards.text: When Eager Construct enters the battlefield, each player may scry 1. (To scry 1, look at the top card of your library, then you may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.flavor: Earth elementals have the eternal strength of stone and the endurance of mountains. Primordially connected to the land they inhabit, they take a long-term view of things, scorning the impetuous haste of short-lived mortal creatures.
cards.name: Earth Elemental

cards.flavor: "From a tiny sprout, the greatest trees grow and flourish. May the seeds of your mind be equally fruitful."
cards.name: Elvish Visionary
cards.text: When Elvish Visionary enters the battlefield, draw a card.

cards.flavor: The only livestock that will survive for long in the Smelting District, ember beasts serve many functions—none of them willingly.
cards.name: Ember Beast
cards.text: Ember Beast can't attack or block alone.

cards.flavor: Only the sun that beats down upon Arashin's walls could shine more brightly.
cards.name: Enduring Scalelord
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever one or more +1/+1 counters are put on another creature you control, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Enduring Scalelord.

cards.flavor: If you stare at the sun for too long, you'll lose your ability to see clearly.
cards.name: Enthralling Victor
cards.text: When Enthralling Victor enters the battlefield, gain control of target creature an opponent controls with power 2 or less until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

cards.flavor: You can always tell the evil one by the dagger he's sticking in you.
cards.name: Evil Twin
cards.text: You may have Evil Twin enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield, except it gains "{U}{B}, {T}: Destroy target creature with the same name as this creature."

cards.flavor: "I run, and thunder follows."
cards.name: Expedite
cards.text:
Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Expedition Raptor
cards.text:
Flying
When Expedition Raptor enters the battlefield, support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two other target creatures.)

cards.flavor: "Boggart blood disgusts me almost as much as the foul creatures themselves."
cards.name: Eyeblight Assassin
cards.text: When Eyeblight Assassin enters the battlefield, target creature an opponent controls gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Pathetic! I've heard more noise in a monastery. Let me hear you, Valor's Reach!"
cards.name: Fan Favorite
cards.text:
Assist (Another player can pay up to {3} of this spell's cost.)
{2}: Fan Favorite gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.

cards.flavor: It shreds its prey as each head fights for the choicest bits.
cards.name: Feral Hydra
cards.text:
Feral Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
{3}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Feral Hydra. Any player may activate this ability.

cards.flavor: The true strength of nature is not the raging storm or the charging rhino, but the inexorable vitality of life.
cards.name: Fertile Ground
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional one mana of any color.

cards.name: Fertilid
cards.text: Fertilid enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.{1}{G}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Fertilid: Target player searches their library for a basic land card and puts it onto the battlefield tapped. Then that player shuffles their library.

cards.name: Fill with Fright
cards.text: Target player discards two cards. Scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.flavor: Inside even the humblest goblin lurks the potential for far greater things—and far worse.
cards.name: Flamewave Invoker
cards.text: {7}{R}: Flamewave Invoker deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.

cards.flavor: "The union of sea and sky makes a perfect cover." —Talrand, sky summoner
cards.name: Fog Bank
cards.text:
Defender, flying
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by Fog Bank.

cards.flavor: It readily attacks much larger prey, knowing retaliation is impossible.
cards.name: Frost Lynx
cards.text: When Frost Lynx enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.flavor: A moment of distraction, a lifetime of regret.
cards.name: Fumble
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand. Gain control of all Auras and Equipment that were attached to it, then attach them to another creature.

cards.flavor: Plan for victory, or prepare for defeat.
cards.name: Game Plan
cards.text:
Assist (Another player can pay up to {5} of this spell's cost.)
Each player shuffles their hand and graveyard into their library, then draws seven cards. Exile Game Plan.

cards.flavor: "Well, who do we have here, Gorm?" "No one, Virtus. No one at all."
cards.name: Gang Up
cards.text:
Assist (Another player can pay up to {X} of this spell's cost. You choose the value of X.)
Destroy target creature with power X or less.

cards.name: Generous Patron
cards.text:
When Generous Patron enters the battlefield, support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two other target creatures.)
Whenever you put one or more counters on a creature you don't control, draw a card.

cards.flavor: "As the experimental population grows, so do the number of myr. It's a perfect equilibrium." —Memnarch
cards.name: Genesis Chamber
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature enters the battlefield, if Genesis Chamber is untapped, that creature's controller creates a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token.

cards.flavor: "The prohibition of unnecessary tossing of the citizenry by giants shall also extend to spontaneous giants." —Isperia's Edict, provision VII.789.2
cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Finding themselves in a new and unexplored world, they immediately set it on fire.
cards.name: Goblin Razerunners
cards.text:
{1}{R}, Sacrifice a land: Put a +1/+1 counter on Goblin Razerunners.
At the beginning of your end step, you may have Goblin Razerunners deal damage equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on it to target player or planeswalker.

cards.flavor: Blessed by the gods. Coveted by mortals. Beholden to neither.
cards.name: Gold-Forged Sentinel
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Gorm the Great
cards.text:
Partner with Virtus the Veiled (When this creature enters the battlefield, target player may put Virtus into their hand from their library, then shuffle.)
Vigilance
Gorm the Great must be blocked if able, and Gorm must be blocked by two or more creatures if able.

cards.flavor: "There's wisdom to be gained in death—whether it be one's own or someone else's." —Jarad, Golgari Lich-Lord
cards.name: Greater Good
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Draw cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power, then discard three cards.

cards.name: Grotesque Mutation
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+1 and gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Grothama, All-Devouring
cards.text:
Other creatures have "Whenever this creature attacks, you may have it fight Grothama, All-Devouring."
When Grothama leaves the battlefield, each player draws cards equal to the amount of damage dealt to Grothama this turn by sources they controlled.

cards.flavor: "Everyone has a price."
cards.name: Gwafa Hazid, Profiteer
cards.text:
{W}{U}, {T}: Put a bribery counter on target creature you don't control. Its controller draws a card.
Creatures with bribery counters on them can't attack or block.

cards.flavor: Silumgar trains those whom he favors in his magic, granting them the ability to spread his disdain across the land.
cards.name: Hand of Silumgar
cards.text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.flavor: "Use everything. Iron, rust, scrap . . . even the ground must join our cause." —Ezuri, renegade leader
cards.name: Hexplate Golem

cards.flavor: "Are you sure this is going to work?" asked Will. "No," said Rowan. "But if it does, it's going to be spectacular."
cards.name: Huddle Up
cards.text:
Assist (Another player can pay up to {2} of this spell's cost.)
Two target players each draw a card.

cards.flavor: Just one can feed a dozen people for a month.
cards.name: Hunted Wumpus
cards.text: When Hunted Wumpus enters the battlefield, each other player may put a creature card from their hand onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Impetuous Protege
cards.text:
Partner with Proud Mentor (When this creature enters the battlefield, target player may put Proud Mentor into their hand from their library, then shuffle.)
Whenever Impetuous Protege attacks, it gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the greatest power among tapped creatures your opponents control.

cards.flavor: "You call it luck. I call it preparation."
cards.name: Impulse
cards.text: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Inner Demon
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2, has flying, and is a Demon in addition to its other types.
When Inner Demon enters the battlefield, all non-Demon creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Few among the Azorius have ever spoken with the sphinxes, but all have felt their influence.
cards.name: Jelenn Sphinx
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance
Whenever Jelenn Sphinx attacks, other attacking creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The competition is but one aspect of the spectacle.
cards.name: Jubilant Mascot
cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, you may pay {3}{W}. If you do, support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two other target creatures.)

cards.flavor: Many a besieged city has surrendered upon hearing the distinctive rumble of the juggernaut.
cards.name: Juggernaut
cards.text:
Juggernaut attacks each combat if able.
Juggernaut can't be blocked by Walls.

cards.flavor: She is adept at navigating the stadium's ever-changing landscape.
cards.name: Jungle Wayfinder
cards.text: When Jungle Wayfinder enters the battlefield, each player may search their library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into their hand, then shuffle their library.

cards.flavor: The harvest god's cornucopia contains the fruits of the fields, the forest, and beyond.
cards.name: Karametra's Favor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Karametra's Favor enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Add one mana of any color."

cards.name: Khorvath Brightflame
cards.text:
Partner with Sylvia Brightspear (When this creature enters the battlefield, target player may put Sylvia into their hand from their library, then shuffle.)
Flying, haste
Knights your team controls have flying and haste.

cards.name: Khorvath's Fury
cards.text: For each player, choose friend or foe. Each friend discards all cards from their hand, then draws that many cards plus one. Khorvath's Fury deals damage to each foe equal to the number of cards in their hand.

cards.flavor: Once a year, Akrasa holds a joust that draws knights and their leotaus from every nation on Bant. The prize is an Akrasan sigil, but the true reward is the angel's kiss.
cards.name: Kiss of the Amesha
cards.text: Target player gains 7 life and draws two cards.

cards.flavor: "Why perch in the crow's nest when I can fly like the crows?"
cards.name: Kitesail Corsair
cards.text: Kitesail Corsair has flying as long as it's attacking.

cards.flavor: She reaches beyond the physical realm, touching the ideals from which all creatures draw their power.
cards.name: Kor Spiritdancer
cards.text:
Kor Spiritdancer gets +2/+2 for each Aura attached to it.
Whenever you cast an Aura spell, you may draw a card.

cards.flavor: A spike and a maul are needed to crack their shells, but the taste is worth the effort.
cards.name: Kraken Hatchling

cards.flavor: The insectile kraul lurk in the tunnels below street level. Many are loyal to the Golgari Swarm, but others follow their own esoteric caste system.
cards.name: Kraul Warrior
cards.text: {5}{G}: Kraul Warrior gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Krav, the Unredeemed
cards.text:
Partner with Regna, the Redeemer (When this creature enters the battlefield, target player may put Regna into their hand from their library, then shuffle.)
{B}, Sacrifice X creatures: Target player draws X cards and gains X life. Put X +1/+1 counters on Krav, the Unredeemed.

cards.name: Land Tax
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for up to three basic land cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: Takedowns in Valor's Reach are never meant to be lethal, but that doesn't mean they won't be incredibly painful.
cards.name: Last Gasp
cards.text: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Some train all their lives for a shot at the title. Some just get really, really lucky.
cards.name: Last One Standing
cards.text: Choose a creature at random, then destroy the rest.

cards.name: Lava-Field Overlord
cards.text:
Assist (Another player can pay up to {7} of this spell's cost.)
Flying
When Lava-Field Overlord enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to target creature an opponent controls.

cards.flavor: Gideon and Nissa carved a path through the Eldrazi swarm, and their Zendikari allies charged into the fray behind them.
cards.name: Lead by Example
cards.text: Support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two target creatures.)

cards.name: Ley Weaver
cards.text:
Partner with Lore Weaver (When this creature enters the battlefield, target player may put Lore Weaver into their hand from their library, then shuffle.)
{T}: Untap two target lands.

cards.flavor: "The victim was either clawed to death or struck by lightning. Possibly both." —Pel Javya, Wojek investigator
cards.name: Lightning Talons
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 and has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.flavor: "The greatest gift Dromoka gives is the ability to fly without wings." —Urdnan, Dromoka warrior
cards.name: Lightwalker
cards.text: Lightwalker has flying as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.flavor: "You harbor such vast potential. It would be such a shame to let you die of old age." —Zul Ashur, lich lord
cards.name: Liturgy of Blood
cards.text: Destroy target creature. Add {B}{B}{B}.

cards.flavor: The person who finishes a journey is rarely the same as the one who starts it.
cards.name: Long Road Home
cards.text: Exile target creature. At the beginning of the next end step, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Lore Weaver
cards.text:
Partner with Ley Weaver (When this creature enters the battlefield, target player may put Ley Weaver into their hand from their library, then shuffle.)
{5}{U}{U}: Target player draws two cards.

cards.flavor: "Even if I should die in the saddle, she will not let me fall to the ground." —Hypatia of the Winged Horse
cards.name: Loyal Pegasus
cards.text:
Flying
Loyal Pegasus can't attack or block alone.

cards.flavor: The view is rivaled only by the decadence of the decor.
cards.name: Luxury Suite
cards.text:
Luxury Suite enters the battlefield tapped unless you have two or more opponents.
{T}: Add {B} or {R}.

cards.flavor: The stadium is well-stocked with hazards to force the action if combatants show too much caution.
cards.name: Magma Hellion
cards.text:
Assist (Another player can pay up to {6} of this spell's cost.)
Trample, haste

cards.flavor: It's the pinnacle of utter destructiveness.
cards.name: Magmatic Force
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, Magmatic Force deals 3 damage to any target.

cards.flavor: "What would Urza think, I wonder, if he could hear how the nature mages still snarl at his name, but venerate the work of his apprentice?" —Teferi, to Jhoira
cards.name: Magus of the Candelabra
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Untap X target lands.

cards.flavor: "I have been brought to this place and I cannot leave. I may be free of the amber, but I am still in prison."
cards.name: Mangara of Corondor
cards.text: {T}: Exile Mangara of Corondor and target permanent.

cards.flavor: "When you're on watch, no noise is harmless and no shadow can be ignored." —Olgard of the Skiltfolk
cards.name: Midnight Guard
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, untap Midnight Guard.

cards.flavor: "You've got to keep your wits about you on the roofs. Not all stones are compliant handholds." —Iveta, rooftop runner
cards.name: Millennial Gargoyle
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: "There will be no secrets between us... like it or not."
cards.name: Mindblade Render
cards.text: Whenever your opponents are dealt combat damage, if any of that damage was dealt by a Warrior, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.flavor: "Ideas drift like petals on the wind. I have only to lift my face to the breeze."
cards.name: Mind's Eye
cards.text: Whenever an opponent draws a card, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.

cards.flavor: "Every creation carries a piece of its creators. Their knowledge, their dreams, their soul. That is the best part."
cards.name: Morbid Curiosity
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an artifact or creature.
Draw cards equal to the converted mana cost of the sacrificed permanent.

cards.flavor: Ancient magic reshapes the stage into a variety of landscapes.
cards.name: Morphic Pool
cards.text:
Morphic Pool enters the battlefield tapped unless you have two or more opponents.
{T}: Add {U} or {B}.

cards.name: Mycosynth Lattice
cards.text:
All permanents are artifacts in addition to their other types.
All cards that aren't on the battlefield, spells, and permanents are colorless.
Players may spend mana as though it were mana of any color.

cards.name: Mystic Confluence
cards.text:
Choose three. You may choose the same mode more than once.
• Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.
• Return target creature to its owner's hand.
• Draw a card.

cards.name: Najeela, the Blade-Blossom
cards.text: Whenever a Warrior attacks, you may have its controller create a 1/1 white Warrior creature token that's tapped and attacking.{W}{U}{B}{R}{G}: Untap all attacking creatures. They gain trample, lifelink, and haste until end of turn. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase. Activate this ability only during combat.

cards.flavor: "It is fascinating to see how the people of this plane replicate magical techniques without a natural gift. Also frustrating." —Jace Beleren
cards.name: Negate
cards.text: Counter target noncreature spell.

cards.flavor: "One head watches for Consulate enforcers. The other watches for renegade thieves." —Crime Lord Gonti
cards.name: Night Market Guard
cards.text: Night Market Guard can block an additional creature each combat.

cards.name: Nimbus Champion
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Nimbus Champion attacks, you may return target creature to its owner's hand if that creature's power is less than or equal to the number of Warriors your team controls.

cards.flavor: The people of the Sevick Isles have a unique understanding of the term "ominous clouds."
cards.name: Nimbus of the Isles
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.name: Nirkana Revenant
cards.text:
Whenever you tap a Swamp for mana, add an additional {B}.
{B}: Nirkana Revenant gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Noosegraf Mob
cards.text:
Noosegraf Mob enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever a player casts a spell, remove a +1/+1 counter from Noosegraf Mob. If you do, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

cards.flavor: Dragons of Silumgar's brood begin to digest their prey even before consuming it, letting their caustic breath do much of the work.
cards.name: Noxious Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Noxious Dragon dies, you may destroy target creature with converted mana cost 3 or less.

cards.flavor: Born of volcanic forces, it thrives on the absolute panic it inspires.
cards.name: Nyxathid
cards.text:
As Nyxathid enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
Nyxathid gets -1/-1 for each card in the chosen player's hand.

cards.name: Okaun, Eye of Chaos
cards.text:
Partner with Zndrsplt, Eye of Wisdom (When this creature enters the battlefield, target player may put Zndrsplt into their hand from their library, then shuffle.)
At the beginning of combat on your turn, flip a coin until you lose a flip.
Whenever a player wins a coin flip, double Okaun's power and toughness until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Her prophecies amaze her even as she speaks them.
cards.name: Omenspeaker
cards.text: When Omenspeaker enters the battlefield, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.flavor: "Opportunity isn't something you wait for. It's something you create."
cards.name: Opportunity
cards.text: Target player draws four cards.

cards.name: Oracle's Insight
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Scry 1, then draw a card." (To scry 1, look at the top card of your library, then you may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.name: Oreskos Explorer
cards.text: When Oreskos Explorer enters the battlefield, search your library for up to X Plains cards, where X is the number of players who control more lands than you. Reveal those cards, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: The wardens watch for illegal tactics and protect spectators from the occasional rogue fireball.
cards.name: Out of Bounds
cards.text:
Assist (Another player can pay up to {3} of this spell's cost.)
Counter target spell.

cards.flavor: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.
cards.name: Pacifism
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.

cards.flavor: "You wish to remember this lesson? I will write it down for you." —Senifet, vizier of Bontu
cards.name: Painful Lesson
cards.text: Target player draws two cards and loses 2 life.

cards.flavor: "The expected way through the trial is far too tedious."
cards.name: Pathmaker Initiate
cards.text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

cards.flavor: "The Vanished must have sent it from beyond to aid us in this struggle." —Kessla, Sylvok shaman
cards.name: Peace Strider
cards.text: When Peace Strider enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.

cards.flavor: "Always a welcome sight breaking through the clouds." —Talrand, sky summoner
cards.name: Peregrine Drake
cards.text:
Flying
When Peregrine Drake enters the battlefield, untap up to five lands.

cards.flavor: "The construction of a defense is not accomplished by adding bricks." —Jace Beleren
cards.name: Phantom Warrior
cards.text: Phantom Warrior can't be blocked.

cards.flavor: "Pain isn't a negative stimulus. Pain is a sign of your imperfection." —Sheoldred, Whispering One
cards.name: Pierce Strider
cards.text: When Pierce Strider enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 3 life.

cards.name: Pir, Imaginative Rascal
cards.text:
Partner with Toothy, Imaginary Friend (When this creature enters the battlefield, target player may put Toothy into their hand from their library, then shuffle.)
If one or more counters would be put on a permanent your team controls, that many plus one of each of those kinds of counters are put on that permanent instead.

cards.name: Pir's Whim
cards.text: For each player, choose friend or foe. Each friend searches their library for a land card, puts it on the battlefield tapped, then shuffles their library. Each foe sacrifices an artifact or enchantment they control.

cards.flavor: "It might fight the Eldrazi, but don't mistake it for a companion, Gideon. It's not interested in your concept of strength through unity."—Najiya, leader of the Tajuru
cards.name: Plated Crusher
cards.text: Trample, hexproof

cards.flavor: The most sensational plays send everyone home breathless.
cards.name: Play of the Game
cards.text:
Assist (Another player can pay up to {6} of this spell's cost.)
Exile all nonland permanents.

cards.flavor: It's rare that the Prakhata Club closes its doors. It's also rare that Lord Gonti meets with Consul Kambal. What are the odds the two would occur on the same day?
cards.name: Prakhata Club Security

cards.flavor: "To the unskilled, it appears as blurred patches of distorted light. Few have seen its true form." —Garruk Wildspeaker
cards.name: Primal Huntbeast
cards.text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.flavor: "Get ready, son."
cards.name: Proud Mentor
cards.text:
Partner with Impetuous Protege (When this creature enters the battlefield, target player may put Impetuous Protege into their hand from their library, then shuffle.)
{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.flavor: "Little flower twirl and bloom, arise from this your rocky tomb. Little warrior slash and brawl, be born again to free us all."
cards.name: Pulse of Murasa
cards.text: Return target creature or land card from a graveyard to its owner's hand. You gain 6 life.

cards.name: Quest for the Gravelord
cards.text:
Whenever a creature dies, you may put a quest counter on Quest for the Gravelord.
Remove three quest counters from Quest for the Gravelord and sacrifice it: Create a 5/5 black Zombie Giant creature token.

cards.flavor: A raptor will follow any order as long as that order is "hunt," "kill," or "go for the guts."
cards.name: Raptor Companion

cards.flavor: "No one chooses to be stitched together into a skaab. If it could speak, it would beg for its own destruction." —Thalia, Knight-Cathar
cards.name: Rebuke
cards.text: Destroy target attacking creature.

cards.flavor: "The gods of Theros are born of the expectations and beliefs of mortals. If I have found godhood, what does that say about their true desires?" —Xenagos, god of revels
cards.name: Reckless Reveler
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice Reckless Reveler: Destroy target artifact.

cards.flavor: Progress comes at a price.
cards.name: Reckless Scholar
cards.text: {T}: Target player draws a card, then discards a card.

cards.flavor: "Show them the light, my love." — Krav, the Unredeemed
cards.name: Regna's Sanction
cards.text: For each player, choose friend or foe. Each friend puts a +1/+1 counter on each creature they control. Each foe chooses one untapped creature they control, then taps the rest.

cards.name: Regna, the Redeemer
cards.text:
Partner with Krav, the Unredeemed (When this creature enters the battlefield, target player may put Krav into their hand from their library, then shuffle.)
Flying
At the beginning of each end step, if your team gained life this turn, create two 1/1 white Warrior creature tokens.

cards.flavor: "I swore to take one head for each member of my family they killed. My task is nowhere near its end."
cards.name: Relentless Hunter
cards.text: {1}{R}{G}: Relentless Hunter gets +1/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Dragons are feared for their breath and their bite, but it is their wings that make them unconquerable. Bring them to earth, and they die like any other beast." —Kassur, Sultai hunter
cards.name: Return to the Earth
cards.text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or creature with flying.

cards.flavor: "In this new world, I have seen the once-devout rhoxes take up arms with the savages of Jund. I would be offended, but I see the wisdom in their choice." —Gernan, Dawnray archer
cards.name: Rhox Brute

cards.flavor: It sleeps with its claws open.
cards.name: Riptide Crab
cards.text:
Vigilance
When Riptide Crab dies, draw a card.

cards.flavor: Is it at the top of the food chain or the bottom?
cards.name: Rotfeaster Maggot
cards.text: When Rotfeaster Maggot enters the battlefield, exile target creature card from a graveyard. You gain life equal to that card's toughness.

cards.name: Rowan Kenrith
cards.text:
+2: During target player's next turn, each creature that player controls attacks if able. 
-2: Rowan Kenrith deals 3 damage to each tapped creature target player controls. 
-8: Target player gets an emblem with "Whenever you activate an ability that isn't a mana ability, copy it. You may choose new targets for the copy."
Partner with Will Kenrith
Rowan Kenrith can be your commander.

cards.flavor: "Loyalty guides me. Pride compels me. Anger sustains me. And the pay isn't bad."
cards.name: Royal Trooper
cards.text: Whenever Royal Trooper blocks, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "I like a quick victory. More time to celebrate."
cards.name: Rushblade Commander
cards.text: Warriors your team controls have haste.

cards.flavor: "A good lagac will carry you through thick and thin. A bad one … well, it's a tasty dinner." —Raff Slugeater, goblin shortcutter
cards.name: Saddleback Lagac
cards.text: When Saddleback Lagac enters the battlefield, support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two other target creatures.)

cards.flavor: Every attack is a test of your defenses. Every hit marks the map of your defeat.
cards.name: Saltwater Stalwart
cards.text: Whenever Saltwater Stalwart deals damage to an opponent, target player draws a card.

cards.name: Savage Ventmaw
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Savage Ventmaw attacks, add {R}{R}{R}{G}{G}{G}. Until end of turn, you don't lose this mana as steps and phases end.

cards.flavor: "A shrill creature that delights in the misery of others—what's not to love?" —Braids, dementia summoner
cards.name: Screeching Buzzard
cards.text:
Flying
When Screeching Buzzard dies, each opponent discards a card.

cards.flavor: Skybridges from across Kylem converge at the grand stadium of Valor's Reach.
cards.name: Sea of Clouds
cards.text:
Sea of Clouds enters the battlefield tapped unless you have two or more opponents.
{T}: Add {W} or {U}.

cards.flavor: "Her voice is the wilderness, savage and pure." —Kamahl, druid acolyte
cards.name: Seedborn Muse
cards.text: Untap all permanents you control during each other player's untap step.

cards.flavor: A light to bring hope in dark times.
cards.name: Seer's Lantern
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}. ({C} represents colorless mana.)
{2}, {T}: Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.flavor: The built-in obstacles force competitors to think three moves ahead.
cards.name: Sentinel Tower
cards.text: Whenever an instant or sorcery spell is cast during your turn, Sentinel Tower deals damage to any target equal to 1 plus the number of instant and sorcery spells cast before that spell this turn.

cards.flavor: Once he gets up and going, he will forever shamble on.
cards.name: Shambling Ghoul
cards.text: Shambling Ghoul enters the battlefield tapped.

cards.flavor: The tools of invention became the weapons of revolution.
cards.name: Shock
cards.text: Shock deals 2 damage to any target.

cards.flavor: "Sea Gate may have fallen, but we still stand. We still fight." —Gideon Jura
cards.name: Shoulder to Shoulder
cards.text:
Support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two target creatures.)
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: "I lead, destruction follows."
cards.name: Sickle Dancer
cards.text: Whenever Sickle Dancer attacks, if your team controls another Warrior, Sickle Dancer gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Be careful in your hunt. The clever little creature can steal your wards and lead you right into the werewolf's den." —Britta, midwife of Gatstaf
cards.name: Silverchase Fox
cards.text: {1}{W}, Sacrifice Silverchase Fox: Exile target enchantment.

cards.flavor: The forest's constant struggle is to keep the spreading flowstone at bay.
cards.name: Skyshroud Claim
cards.text: Search your library for up to two Forest cards and put them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: Victories at Valor's Reach are broadcast via griffins in the sky above.
cards.name: Skystreamer
cards.text:
Assist (Another player can pay up to {4} of this spell's cost.)
Flying
When Skystreamer enters the battlefield, target player gains 4 life.

cards.flavor: It's sent into unguilded districts by the Orzhov to collect the souls of those no one will miss.
cards.name: Slum Reaper
cards.text: When Slum Reaper enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature.

cards.flavor: Some spectators love an underdog, but others are just as happy to support a proven winner.
cards.name: Soaring Show-Off
cards.text:
Flying
When Soaring Show-Off enters the battlefield, each player draws a card.

cards.flavor: "You will be reimbursed for your donation." "The reimbursement is spiritual." —Temple signs
cards.name: Solemn Offering
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 4 life.

cards.name: Soulblade Corrupter
cards.text:
Partner with Soulblade Renewer (When this creature enters the battlefield, target player may put Soulblade Renewer into their hand from their library, then shuffle.)
Deathtouch
Whenever a creature with a +1/+1 counter on it attacks one of your opponents, that creature gains deathtouch until end of turn.

cards.name: Soulblade Renewer
cards.text:
Partner with Soulblade Corrupter (When this creature enters the battlefield, target player may put Soulblade Corrupter into their hand from their library, then shuffle.)
When Soulblade Renewer enters the battlefield, support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two other target creatures.)

cards.flavor: One glamer leads him far from home. The next washes away his memory that home was ever anywhere but at her side.
cards.name: Sower of Temptation
cards.text:
Flying
When Sower of Temptation enters the battlefield, gain control of target creature for as long as Sower of Temptation remains on the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Aspiring to earn their place in the afterlife, acolytes train every day against those who fell short of that glory.
cards.name: Sparring Mummy
cards.text: When Sparring Mummy enters the battlefield, untap target creature.

cards.flavor: The first searchlights were given as gifts, symbols of cooperation, to the emissaries present at the signing of the Guildpact.
cards.name: Spectral Searchlight
cards.text: {T}: Choose a player. That player adds one mana of any color they choose.

cards.flavor: Mages and warriors recruited from across Kylem display their skills at Valor's Reach.
cards.name: Spellseeker
cards.text: When Spellseeker enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an instant or sorcery card with converted mana cost 2 or less, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: With practice, the measurement of magic can lead to its mastery.
cards.name: Spell Snare
cards.text: Counter target spell with converted mana cost 2.

cards.flavor: Synchronized spell weaving is a difficult but rewarding skill to master.
cards.name: Spellweaver Duo
cards.text:
Assist (Another player can pay up to {6} of this spell's cost.)
When Spellweaver Duo enters the battlefield, you may return target tapped creature to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: From thrilling combat to unparalleled vistas, Valor's Reach has it all.
cards.name: Spire Garden
cards.text:
Spire Garden enters the battlefield tapped unless you have two or more opponents.
{T}: Add {R} or {G}.

cards.flavor: "Potions! Mana potions, health potions, energy potions—get your potions here!"
cards.name: Stadium Vendors
cards.text: When Stadium Vendors enters the battlefield, choose a player. That player adds two mana of any one color they choose.

cards.flavor: It glides over the landscape. It also happens to be one.
cards.name: Steppe Glider
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance
{1}{W}: Target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it gains flying and vigilance until end of turn.

cards.name: Stolen Strategy
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, exile the top card of each opponent's library. Until end of turn, you may cast nonland cards from among those exiled cards, and you may spend mana as though it were mana of any color to cast those spells.

cards.flavor: The sculptor, like most artists, put his heart and soul in his work. But the newly awakened golem decided he wanted his creator's other, more tangible parts.
cards.name: Stone Golem

cards.flavor: The line between victory and defeat can be as slim as a razor's edge.
cards.name: Stunning Reversal
cards.text:
The next time you would lose the game this turn, instead draw seven cards and your life total becomes 1. 
Exile Stunning Reversal.

cards.flavor: In the Gudul delta, bloodfly bites are indistinguishable from spear wounds.
cards.name: Swarm of Bloodflies
cards.text:
Flying
Swarm of Bloodflies enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever another creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Swarm of Bloodflies.

cards.flavor: Say hello to your new friend.
cards.name: Switcheroo
cards.text: Exchange control of two target creatures.

cards.flavor: The smallest seed of regret can bloom into redemption.
cards.name: Swords to Plowshares
cards.text: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.

cards.name: Sylvia Brightspear
cards.text:
Partner with Khorvath Brightflame (When this creature enters the battlefield, target player may put Khorvath into their hand from their library, then shuffle.)
Double strike
Dragons your team controls have double strike.

cards.flavor: "Many scales make the skin of a dragon." —Abzan wisdom
cards.name: Take Up Arms
cards.text: Create three 1/1 white Warrior creature tokens.

cards.flavor: In times of infestation and war, Zendikar favors the blades that strike in unison.
cards.name: Tandem Tactics
cards.text: Up to two target creatures each get +1/+2 until end of turn. You gain 2 life.

cards.flavor: Rakdos cultists are her best customers. They never flinch at pain and are seldom good at math.
cards.name: Tavern Swindler
cards.text: {T}, Pay 3 life: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, you gain 6 life.

cards.flavor: Raising the bones of Hekjek the Mad proved far easier than getting them to lie back down.
cards.name: Tenacious Dead
cards.text: When Tenacious Dead dies, you may pay {1}{B}. If you do, return it to the battlefield tapped under its owner's control.

cards.name: The Crowd Goes Wild
cards.text:
Assist (Another player can pay up to {X} of this spell's cost. You choose the value of X.)
Support X. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to X target creatures.)
Each creature with a +1/+1 counter on it gains trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Some competitors fight for glory or money. Some just like hitting people.
cards.name: Thrasher Brute
cards.text: Whenever Thrasher Brute or another Warrior enters the battlefield under your team's control, target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.flavor: "Welcome to the winning team."
cards.name: Thrilling Encore
cards.text: Put onto the battlefield under your control all creature cards in all graveyards that were put there from the battlefield this turn.

cards.flavor: Lightning reflexes, thunderous might.
cards.name: Thunder Strike
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.flavor: The stadium tests more than just fighting skill. For example, swimming ability.
cards.name: Tidespout Tyrant
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a spell, return target permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Together Forever
cards.text:
When Together Forever enters the battlefield, support 2. (Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two other target creatures.)
{1}: Choose target creature with a counter on it. When that creature dies this turn, return that card to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Toothy, Imaginary Friend
cards.text:
Partner with Pir, Imaginative Rascal (When this creature enters the battlefield, target player may put Pir into their hand from their library, then shuffle.)
Whenever you draw a card, put a +1/+1 counter on Toothy, Imaginary Friend.
When Toothy leaves the battlefield, draw a card for each +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.flavor: Fblthp had always hated crowds.
cards.name: Totally Lost
cards.text: Put target nonland permanent on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: True-Name Nemesis
cards.text:
As True-Name Nemesis enters the battlefield, choose a player.
True-Name Nemesis has protection from the chosen player. (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything controlled by that player.)

cards.flavor: "Do you hear that, Sarkhan? The glory of the horde! I made a legend from what you abandoned." —Zurgo, khan of the Mardu
cards.name: Trumpet Blast
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Though tempered differently, all wills can be broken." —Inquisitor Kyrik
cards.name: Tyrant's Machine
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.name: Unflinching Courage
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has trample and lifelink.

cards.flavor: Relentless as the sea, remorseless as death.
cards.name: Urborg Drake
cards.text:
Flying
Urborg Drake attacks each combat if able.

cards.name: Vampire Charmseeker
cards.text:
Assist (Another player can pay up to {6} of this spell's cost.)
Flying
When Vampire Charmseeker enters the battlefield, return target instant, sorcery, or creature card from a graveyard to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Veteran Explorer
cards.text: When Veteran Explorer dies, each player may search their library for up to two basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield. Then each player who searched their library this way shuffles it.

cards.flavor: The favored noisemaker of goblins ever since the wardens cracked down on explosives.
cards.name: Victory Chimes
cards.text:
Untap Victory Chimes during each other player's untap step.
{T}: A player of your choice adds {C}.

cards.name: Vigor
cards.text:
Trample
If damage would be dealt to a creature you control other than Vigor, prevent that damage. Put a +1/+1 counter on that creature for each 1 damage prevented this way.
When Vigor is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.

cards.flavor: Brutality had never been so exquisite.
cards.name: Virtus's Maneuver
cards.text: For each player, choose friend or foe. Each friend returns a creature card from their graveyard to their hand. Each foe sacrifices a creature they control.

cards.name: Virtus the Veiled
cards.text:
Partner with Gorm the Great (When this creature enters the battlefield, target player may put Gorm into their hand from their library, then shuffle.)
Deathtouch
Whenever Virtus the Veiled deals combat damage to a player, that player loses half their life, rounded up.

cards.flavor: Humans still feared wolves, though no connection between them and the curse of lycanthropy had ever been proved.
cards.name: Wandering Wolf
cards.text: Creatures with power less than Wandering Wolf's power can't block it.

cards.flavor: Razia, archangel of war, demands total commitment.
cards.name: War's Toll
cards.text:
Whenever an opponent taps a land for mana, tap all lands that player controls.
If a creature an opponent controls attacks, all creatures that opponent controls attack if able.

cards.flavor: "Beware an eddy where there should be none or a stretch that flows too fast or too slow."—Old Fishbones, Martyne river guide
cards.name: Watercourser
cards.text: {U}: Watercourser gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Will Kenrith
cards.text:
+2: Until your next turn, up to two target creatures each have base power and toughness 0/3 and lose all abilities.
-2: Target player draws two cards. Until your next turn, instant, sorcery, and planeswalker spells that player casts cost {2} less to cast.
-8: Target player gets an emblem with "Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, copy it. You may choose new targets for the copy."
Partner with Rowan Kenrith
Will Kenrith can be your commander.

cards.flavor: "Our pyromancer's flames may not have killed them, but they bought us the time we needed." —The War Diaries
cards.name: Wrap in Flames
cards.text: Wrap in Flames deals 1 damage to each of up to three target creatures. Those creatures can't block this turn.

cards.flavor: Poets dream the verses of otherworldly stories. Artificers dream the blueprints of otherplanar artifacts.
cards.name: Yotian Soldier
cards.text: Vigilance

cards.name: Zndrsplt, Eye of Wisdom
cards.text:
Partner with Okaun, Eye of Chaos (When this creature enters the battlefield, target player may put Okaun into their hand from their library, then shuffle.)
At the beginning of combat on your turn, flip a coin until you lose a flip.
Whenever a player wins a coin flip, draw a card.

cards.flavor: Zndrsplt retired from officiating when she teamed up with Okaun, but she still knows the penalties better than anyone else.
cards.name: Zndrsplt's Judgment
cards.text: For each player, choose friend or foe. Each friend creates a token that's a copy of a creature they control. Each foe returns a creature they control to its owner's hand.
